meanings.definition: To install or connect (a device or system) by means of hardwiring.
meanings.sent1: I will hardwire the new security camera to the main control panel.
meanings.sent2: It is important to hardwire the alarm system for better reliability.
meanings.sent3: Why did the robot try to hardwire itself to the toaster?
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work is hardwired into her DNA.
meanings.sent5: The electrician had to hardwire the entire house after the lightning strike.

meanings.definition: To make something a permanent or unchangeable part of a person's nature or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The traumatic experience hardwired a fear of heights in him.
meanings.sent2: Parents often try to hardwire good manners into their children.
meanings.sent3: His love for ice cream seems to be hardwired into his genes.
meanings.sent4: The song lyrics were hardwired into her memory after just one listen.
meanings.sent5: The coach worked hard to hardwire a winning mentality into the team.
